materials.raw_text: Cobalt (C) - 20 g, Molybdenum (Mo) - 45 g, Neodymium (Nd) - 70 g, Praseodymium (Pr) - 10 g, Tungsten (W) - 5 g

sourcing.instructions: Cobalt: Metal suppliers or online chemical vendors; Molybdenum: Specialty metal suppliers; Neodymium: Rare earth suppliers; Praseodymium: Rare earth suppliers; Tungsten: Metal suppliers
steps: Cobalt: Metal suppliers or online chemical vendors; Molybdenum: Specialty metal suppliers; Neodymium: Rare earth suppliers; Praseodymium: Rare earth suppliers; Tungsten: Metal suppliers

1. Measure each ingredient using a precise scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine cobalt, molybdenum, neodymium, praseodymium, and tungsten. 3. Mix thoroughly using a mechanical mixer for 10 minutes to ensure uniform distribution.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure each ingredient using a precise scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine cobalt, molybdenum, neodymium, praseodymium, and tungsten. 3. Mix thoroughly using a mechanical mixer for 10 minutes to ensure uniform distribution.

steps: 1. Preheat furnace to 1500°C. 2. Place the mixed material in a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 3. Heat for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloy formation.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat furnace to 1500°C. 2. Place the mixed material in a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 3. Heat for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloy formation.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to 800°C naturally. 2. Once at 800°C, remove the crucible and place it on a heat-resistant surface to cool to room temperature, approximately 1-2 hours.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to 800°C naturally. 2. Once at 800°C, remove the crucible and place it on a heat-resistant surface to cool to room temperature, approximately 1-2 hours.

steps: 1. After cooling, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a grinder to shape the sample to the dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches, ensuring even surfaces. 3. Sand the edges to eliminate sharpness and achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to protect the surface if required.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. After cooling, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a grinder to shape the sample to the dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches, ensuring even surfaces. 3. Sand the edges to eliminate sharpness and achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to protect the surface if required.
